Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this hotel - which we felt was good value. Very clean, tidy and well run with a good breakfast. We were pleased with our room. All staff very helpful. The hotel is a 20 minute walk from the city centre but with good bus links.
Reviews.Author: CharlesX

Reviews.Content: Normal I麓ve been in Diana Park in June 2008. The hotel is located in a very quiet area, about 1,5 mile from historical center, and you can buy one-way bus tickets in reception. The clerk Graziella is very polite, as well employees from cleansing and breakfast. However, it麓s not easy to find the hotel, even with a GPS and being in a 1-block street, because it麓s very discrete. Clerk Marco M. treated us in an arrogant and unpolite way, because we left room card in reception by morning. Parking has only five places. Breakfast was very good. So, it has some problems, but in general is good.
Reviews.Author: ricardo_papa

Reviews.Content: excellent hotel I spent 4 nights in Diana Park Hotel and my stay was really relaxing, excellent. Since I am travelling for business I appreciate the nice, clean and well supplied room (finally a hotel that has bright lights in the rooms and not a wake light of 40 Watts!) The bathroom has bathtube with hydromassage, hairdryer, a magnifier mirror with light (finally I can see exactly what I do during make up...) In the meantime I appreciate a quiet hotel, not noisy, not many people around..,.The room has TV, minibar and free ADSL conncetion. (you can get the cable with 10鈧?at the reception,and the money is refund when you give back the cable).I had to go to the Fortezza (for exhibiton) so no time for walking...but in 5-10 minutes (it depends on the traffic) the exhibition center can be rached by taxi. Of course, you can also walk. The staff is extremely kind, helpful and friendly.I certainly will go back to Diana and I already booked my next stays in Firenze. I definitely would suggest this hotel. The quality/price rate is really excellent.
Reviews.Author: Busybee11

Reviews.Content: Far from center We have just returned from a trip to Italy , where we spent a few day in Florence. We stayed at the Hotel Diana Park for three nights. The hotel was good value for money and the room was nice , however we were at least a 20 minute walk from the city center. The receptionist was rude and not very helpful or informative. Our room was downstairs and when you opened the door you were in reception. This made it a little noisy as we could hear phones ringing etc . Breakfast was nice, a good selection of cereals , fruit and breads to choose from. Word to the wise be prepared to queue for everything in Florence. It is a little crazy. I would recommend reserving your tickets bforehand. We queued for almost 2 hours to get into some attractions.
Reviews.Author: ferien

Reviews.Content: Comfortable, air-conditioned clean Location 20 minute walk to centre, Ok but stayed out all day rather than walking twice in evening. Convenient bus service picks up/drops off outside Hotel, but took us length of stay to work it out.Resort Unfortunately it rained 3 of our four days, and we both had tooth ache so spent most time at hospitals or Dentists. So our impression of Florence is flawed, need to go back again with umbrellas  strong painkillers. Incidentally anyone considering combining Florence with Venice, go to Florence first, as it suffers in comparison to Venice.Beach Not applicableTransport Buses - Good and cheap once worked outTrains 鈥?Venice to Florence,like Eurostar, in fact it is Eurostar under RailItalia bannerHotelReception 鈥?Reasonable size, not very welcoming Bedrooms 鈥?Comfortable, air-conditioned clean and colourful. We had a room at the front which was a good sized room with bath, unfortunately traffic noise went on all night, we changed room for one at back of Hotel which was quiet but smaller.Food 鈥?Breakfast only, taken in reception area, very basic.Weather Not goodSummarySuitable for business travellers, not really a tourist hotel
Reviews.Author: passportago

Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodation Just a word, absolutely good. Friendly staff, beautiful rooms, superb heating, good breakfast (Manolo is very special. I will stay there again and I recommend it to all of you.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: GREAT SERVICE I stayed at the DIANA PARK HOTEL in January 2006, and I would like to thank SUSANNA and LUCIA for the great help they gave us in making our stay in Florence the best possible...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Traffic Noise We stayed several nights in mid-October, 2004.Beautiful little hotel. Beautifully furnished room.Very nice Front Desk staff.But, this hotel faces a very busy street. There wasno escape from the din.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Noisy, noisy, noisy... Very nice staff. Most helpful and polite. Clean rooms etc etc. But this hotel is on a main road that is like an Italian race track. Motor cycles and Vespas, together with buses etc, and air conditioning that shuts off in the evening... so you have to open the windows to get cool air. The noise is just TOO much of a problem. Not expensive but, frankly, you would do better at a B and B than this for the money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Baby friendly Excellent service and value for money. We took our 10 month old son and the staff were very accomodating and helpful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, but beware!! I have just returned from the Diana Park Hotel - the room was lovely BUT BEWARE rooms 50 and 51 - they are on the ground floor and open out directly onto the reception/breakfast/bar area (50 is worse than 51), so you hear noise from the breakfast area and reception from very early each morning, and sometimes late if guests are having drinks. Even worse is the fact that both these rooms face directly onto Via Pascoli which experiences incessant heavy traffic day and night - and the window is about 2 metres away from all this - the noise is bad even with the shutters closed and the window shut. As a result, what was to have been a relaxing break turned into an exhausting sleep deprivation exercise - the hotel was fully booked, so there was no chance to change rooms either. So, my advice is specify a quiet room when booking. A minor annoyance is the fact that you frequently have to wait for a table at breakfast time - there are only a handful of tables for a much larger number of rooms!
Reviews.Author: PhilLondonUK

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel I went to italy for a week and stayed 3 nights in this hotel when visiting florence. It was the best hotel during my vacation! Great rooms, with all that you need. The service was fine (nothing to complain about). The breakfast served were similar to the other hotels visited.The hotel isn't located right in the center of Florence, but since Florence is a small city you can still walk to the city center (15 min). You could also take a bus(bus stop just outside the hotel). Its also an excelent choise if travel by car, since the hotel has a private parking. Oh and the price i paid for a double room a night? 90鈧?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: lovely hotel A really lovely hotel near to the centre of Florence. We stayed here for a few days at the end of July. The room price was more than competitve compared to other hotels in Florence. In addition it really reaches the 4 star level! Nevertheless, as the city hotels do, this hotel is situated in a noisy street. But the rooms at the back of the hotel are more quiet than the front-rooms (we stayed in room nr 105 at the back). The only disappointment was the small size of bath-tube. It was a really surprise, how can one move in it! But the others: furniture, decoration, air-conditioning, minibar, the buffet-breakfast, the kindness of the hotel staff maked our stay unforgettable.That makes the real difference: they have a private parking for cars (but it is advised to reserve it in advance, since there are only 8 parking places!).Getting to the old town is very easy due to the bus lines (25,12,1,7) which bring you to either to the Cathedral, or to the railway station.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay there again.
Reviews.Author: funtrip

Reviews.Content: Exceptional Staff We stayed here beginning of June and were pleasantly surprised at the value - the rooms were half the price of other 4 star hotels in Florence. The Hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Cathedral or a 5 minute (6 Euro) taxi ride (hence price). The rooms at the back of the hotel are larger than the front. The staff here are the best I have ever come across in all of my travels and just couldn't do enough for you - they really make a difference. Getting to and from the hotel need not be a pain as the taxi system in Florence is exceptional as all rests, hotels, etc have a digital service line so a taxi is never more than a few minutes away. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again and again.
Reviews.Author: HCM280
